intro: Paepalanthus apacarensis var. humilis, commonly known as the dwarf paepalanthus, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of southern South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that collect water, facilitating its adaptation to arid environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires bright, indirect sunlight for optimal growth. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
